metadata.title: CVE-2017-8309 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Memory leak in the audio/audio.c in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by repeatedlystarting and stopping audio capture.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-data - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
